00002 //
00003 // KDataWriter.cxx
00004 // KDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de> on 4/30/10.
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // This class writes out an KDS file. The basic use is, after creating
00011 // an instance of this class, get a pointer to an event object, set the 
00012 // various data parameters in the KDS file and then call KDataWriter::Fill
00013 // to add the event to an output tree. This file creates an KDS file with
00014 // trees filled with KHLAEvents, but you can also select Raw and HLaMC events.
00015 //
00016

00035 KDataWriter::KDataWriter(const Char_t* name, const Char_t* eventType, 
00036                                                                                                  const Char_t* mode)

00078 Bool_t KDataWriter::OpenFile(const Char_t* fileName, const Char_t* eventType,
00079                                                                                                                          const Char_t* mode)
00080 {
00081         
00082         if(fLocalEvent == 0)
00083                 fLocalEvent = KEventFactory::NewEvent(eventType);
00084         
00085         return OpenFile(fileName, &fLocalEvent, mode);
00086         
00087 }

00089 
00090 Bool_t KDataWriter::OpenFile(const Char_t* fileName, KEvent **anEvent,
00091                                                                                                                          const Char_t* mode)
00092 {
00093         if(bIsReady)
00094         {
00095                 cout << "KDataWriter::OpenFile. You already have a file opened. Close it first." << endl;
00096                 return false;
00097         }
00098         
00099         Close(); 
00100         
00101         TFile *mFile = OpenFileForWriting(fileName, mode);
00102         
00103         if(!mFile->IsZombie()){
00104                 
00105                 if(SetTreeBranch(anEvent)){
00106                         //cout << "KDataWriter Done Opening File" << endl;
00107                         bIsReady = true;
00108                         return true;
00109                 }
00110                 else return false;
00111         }
00112         else {
00113                 cout << "KDataWriter File is Zombie." << endl;
00114                 return false;
00115         }
00116 }
00117 
00118         
00119 Bool_t KDataWriter::SetTreeBranch(KEvent **anEvent)
00120 {
00121         //This method must be called After calling OpenFileForWriting
00122         //because the order of the creation of the TFile and the TTree 
00123         //matters to ROOT
00124         
00125         if(fTree == 0){
00126                 cout << "KDataWriter SetTreeBranch - fail becaust fTree == 0" << endl;
00127                 return false;
00128         }
00129 
00130         fEventBranch = 0;
00131         
00132         try{
00133                 
00134                 if( dynamic_cast<KHLAEvent*>(*anEvent) != 0) {
00135                         //cout << typeid(*hlaEv).name() << endl;
00136                         //cout << &hlaEv << " " << &anEvent << endl;
00137                         fEventBranch = dynamic_cast<TBranchElement*>(fTree->Branch(GetBranchName().c_str(), kHLAClassName, anEvent, 512000, 99));
00138                         
00139                 }
00140                 else if( dynamic_cast<KRawEvent*>(*anEvent) !=0 ) {
00141                         //cout << typeid(*hlaEv).name() << endl;
00142                         //cout << hlaEv << " " << anEvent << endl;
00143                         fEventBranch = dynamic_cast<TBranchElement*>(fTree->Branch(GetBranchName().c_str(), kRawClassName, anEvent, 512000, 99));
00144                         
00145                 }
00146                 else if( dynamic_cast<KHLaMCEvent*>(*anEvent) !=0 ) {
00147                         //cout << typeid(*hlaEv).name() << endl;
00148                         //cout << hlaEv << " " << anEvent << endl;
00149                         fEventBranch = dynamic_cast<TBranchElement*>(fTree->Branch(GetBranchName().c_str(), kHLaMCClassName, anEvent, 512000, 99));
00150                         
00151                 }
00152                 else{
00153                         cout << "KDataWriter::SetTreeBranch(KHLAEvent* ) Unsupported Event Class " << endl;
00154                 }
00155 
00156         }
00157         catch (exception& e) {
00158 
00159                 cout << "Exception: " << e.what() << endl;
00160                 return false;
00161         }
00162         
00163         if(fEventBranch != 0){
00164                 if(fEventBranch->IsZombie()){
00165                         cout << fEventBranch->GetClassName() << endl; 
00166                         cout << "KDataWriter::SetTreeBranch. TBranch is Zombie" << endl;
00167                         return false;
00168                 }
00169                 else return true;
00170         }
00171         else {
00172                 return false;
00173         }
00174 
00175         
00176 }
00177 
00178 KEvent* KDataWriter::GetEvent(void)
00179 {
00180         if(!bIsReady) return 0;
00181         
00182         KEvent *event = 0;
00183         if(fEventBranch !=0){
00184                 if(!fEventBranch->IsZombie())
00185                 {
00186                         event = (KEvent*)fEventBranch->GetObject();
00187                         
00188                         if(fLocalEvent != 0){
00189                                 if(fLocalEvent != event){
00190                                         cout << "Surprisng result. Please don't print this message. :)" << endl;
00191                                 }
00192                         }
00193                         
00194                 }
00195         }
00196         
00197         return event;
00198 }

00200 Bool_t KDataWriter::IsReady(void) const
00201 {
00202         return bIsReady;
00203 }
00204 
00205 Int_t KDataWriter::Fill(void)
00206 {
00207         if(IsReady()) {                 
00208                 fFile = fTree->GetCurrentFile(); //new files will automatically be created
00209                 //if the file exceeds fgMaxTreeSize, which is 100 Gigabytes by default
00210                 //therefore, we must make sure we point to the right file. 
00211                 //see the documentation in TTree::ChangeFile(TFile *).
00212                 KEvent *e = GetEvent();
00213                 if(e!=0) e->Compact();  //if this were to fail, then something would be terribly wrong
00214                 
00215                 fFile->cd();
00216                 return fTree->Fill();
00217         }
00218         else 
00219                 return -1;
00220 }
00221 
00222 Int_t KDataWriter::Write(const Char_t *name, Int_t option, Int_t bufsize)
00223 {
00224         //The options are the same as those options in TObject::Write
00225         
00226         if(fFile == 0) return -1;
00227         if(!IsReady()) return -1;
00228         
00229         if(fFile->IsOpen()){
00230                 fFile->cd();
00231                 
00232                 WriteTCuts(); //add the TCuts. 
00233                                 
00234                 return fTree->Write(name, option, bufsize);  //add the tree
00235         }
00236         else {
00237                 return -1;
00238         }
00239 
00240 }
00241 
00242 void KDataWriter::WriteTCuts(void)
00243 {
00244         if(fFile == 0) return;
00245         
00246         if(fFile->IsOpen()){
00247                 fFile->cd();
00248                 
00249                 TCut mCut0("fid401","fid401");
00250                 mCut0 = "fDetectorNumber == 0";
00251                 mCut0.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);  //kWriteDelete prevents multiple keys
00252                 //being written to the file in case somebody calls Write multiple times
00253                 //however, this assurances is not applied to the tree. So the user
00254                 //should be aware of this.
00255                 
00256                 TCut mCut1("fid402","fid402");
00257                 mCut1 = "fDetectorNumber == 9";
00258                 mCut1.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00259                 
00260                 TCut mCut2("id2","id2");
00261                 mCut2 = "fDetectorNumber == 32";
00262                 mCut2.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00263                 
00264                 TCut mCut3("id3","id3");
00265                 mCut3 = "fDetectorNumber == 11";
00266                 mCut3.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00267                 
00268                 TCut mCut4("id4","id4");
00269                 mCut4 = "fDetectorNumber == 23";
00270                 mCut4.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00271 
00272                 TCut mCut5("id5","id5");
00273                 mCut5 = "fDetectorNumber == 5";
00274                 mCut5.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00275                 
00276                 TCut mCut6("id6","id6");
00277                 mCut6 = "fDetectorNumber == 17";
00278                 mCut6.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00279                 
00280                 TCut mCut7("id401","id401");
00281                 mCut7 = "fDetectorNumber == 14";
00282                 mCut7.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00283 
00284                 TCut mCut8("id402","id402");
00285                 mCut8 = "fDetectorNumber == 26";
00286                 mCut8.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00287                 
00288                 TCut mCut9("id403","id403");
00289                 mCut9 = "fDetectorNumber == 2";
00290                 mCut9.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00291                 
00292                 TCut mCut10("id404","id404");
00293                 mCut10 = "fDetectorNumber == 20";
00294                 mCut10.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00295                 
00296                 TCut mCut11("id405","id405");
00297                 mCut11 = "fDetectorNumber == 29";
00298                 mCut11.Write("", TObject::kWriteDelete);
00299                 
00300         }
00301         
00302 }
00303 
00304 Bool_t KDataWriter::Close(Option_t *opt)
00305 {
00306         //cout << "KDataWriter Close"<< endl;
00307         if(bIsReady == false)
00308                 return true; //we've already closed the file. 
00309         
00310         fEventBranch = 0;
00311         if(fLocalEvent != 0){
00312                 if(KEventFactory::DeleteEvent(fLocalEvent))
00313                         fLocalEvent = 0;
00314         }
00315         bIsReady = !KDataFileIO::Close(opt);
00316         
00317         return !bIsReady;
00318 }
00319 
00320 
00321 TTree* KDataWriter::CloneTree(TTree *treeIn, Long64_t nEnt, Option_t* anOpt)
00322 {
00323         if(fTree != 0)
00324                 delete fTree; fTree = 0;
00325         
00326         if(fLocalEvent != 0)
00327                 KEventFactory::DeleteEvent(fLocalEvent); fLocalEvent = 0;
00328         
00329         //if we clone the tree from treeIn, then we don't use
00330         //the local event object memory space. So, we should delete it. 
00331         
00332         fTree = treeIn->CloneTree(nEnt, anOpt);
00333         
00334         return fTree;
00335 }
00336 
00337 TTree *KDataWriter::ConcatenateTrees(TList* li, Option_t *anOpt)
00338 {
00339         if(fTree != 0)
00340                 delete fTree; fTree = 0;
00341         
00342         if(fLocalEvent != 0)
00343                 KEventFactory::DeleteEvent(fLocalEvent); fLocalEvent = 0;
00344         
00345         fTree = TTree::MergeTrees(li,anOpt);
00346         
00347         return fTree;
00348 }
